newsitem.title: CROATIA: Serb hijacker wounds Moslem on a "Blue Route".
newsitem.headline: Serb hijacker wounds Moslem on a "Blue Route".

text.p: A Bosnian Moslem motorist travelling through Serb-held territory along a NATO-secured motorway was shot and wounded when his car was hijacked, officials said on Friday.

The victim Nadil Hasic and his wife were travelling on the busy "Route Arizona" when they were pulled over by unindentified car-jackers. They were ordered to lie on the ground and Hasic was shot in the shoulder.
A U.S. helicopter evacuated Hasic who was treated at the U.S. hospital at the village of Kime.
The vehicle has been recovered, a statement from the press office of the NATO-led multi-national peace Implementation Force (IFOR) in Tuzla said.
The Route Arizona which connects the northern Bosnian town of Tuzla with Croatia passes through a patch of Bosnian Serb territory and is patrolled and secured by IFOR.
Thousands of private and commercial vehicles use the road every day and it is generally regarded as safe.
The mandate of the 60,000-strong force, responsible for keeping the former warring factions apart, is expiring in two months, but a scaled-down presence is expected to remain in place.
